ref: 9682 bhrāśayati ʻ causes to fall ʼ Gr. (ní bhrāśáyant -- RV.) [bhraṁśayati KātyŚr., Pk. bhaṁsaï. -- √bhraṁś]
A. bhāhiba intr. ʻ to float ʼ, bhāhanīyā ʻ inundating ʼ, bhāhāiba ʻ to cause to float ʼ;
Si. bahanavā, bānavā ʻ to lower, let down, put in, fix, place ʼ
H. Hendriksen BSOAS xii 162 (or < bhraṁśayati), caus. bāvanavā ʻ to lay or put down, cause to lie down ʼ.
